g.title: goal-internet-services
g.text: ðŸŽ¯ Rust a common choice for programs running on internet services
Ratio of P99.99 to P50 latencies is lower
Data centers require fewer resources to sustain same level of traffic
Rate of security vulnerabilities and serious bugs is dramatically reduced
Improved employee retention and ability to recruit

g.title: prod-tooling
g.text: Able to troubleshoot correctness problems that arise in production
Able to troubleshoot performance problems that arise in production
Live, low-overhead profilers for CPU and memory usage

g.title: onboarding-time
g.text: Time to be highly productive is measured in months
Clear transition paths from other major languages

g.title: dev-tooling
g.text: Able to understand programs in terms of async behavior
Able to fix correctness problems in development environment
Able to fix performance problems in development environment
Rust well integrated into common IDEs
Profilers for CPU and memory usage

g.title: semi-stable-apis
g.text: Compiler offers semi-stable APIs that others can use
Shared crate for representing Rust types
Access to Rust type information and type check results
Access to the MIR for a given function

g.title: fundamentals
g.text: Easy to contribute to the compiler
Extending language possible by mere humans

g.title: async-stack
g.text: Can quickly stand up an async application
Devs able to focus on 'business logic'
I/O uring support in tokio, other runtimes

g.title: easy-lang
g.text: Using Rust feels smooth and convenient
Dynamic dispatch (dyn trait) more powerful, easier to use

g.title: extensible
g.text: Rust libraries can take control of the developer experience
Macros, lints have access to type information

g.title: async-lang
g.text: Using Async I/O comparable in complexity to Sync I/O
Access to a wide variety of useful libraries on crates.io
Easy access to high performance networking
Async resource cleanup works well (async drop)

g.title: core-lang
g.text: Rust language scales smoothly without 'complexity cliffs'
Rust able to express the patterns more complex code needs
Dynamic dispatch (dyn trait) more powerful, easier to use
